alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:26PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Somerset, southern Wicomico and southwestern Worcester Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 526 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Hebron to Deal Island to 10 miles east of Saint Inigoes Creek. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Fruitland, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore and Salisbury University around 600 PM EDT. Westover around 610 PM EDT. Marion Station and Lawsonia around 615 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Wetipquin, Trinity, Cokesbury, Eden, Kingston, Longridge, Mount Vernon, Whiton, Whitesburg and Green Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
